_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: All Other Miscellaneous Store Retailers (except Tobacco Stores)

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Shawnee Milling Company operates rural feed stores offering anhydrous ammonia to local farmers.  Onsite
storage and dispensing of this toxic chemical varies in quantities based on seasonal application demand.  For
approximately 3-4 months of the year, maximum quantities of anhydrous ammonia are reduced to less than 20%
(12,096 pounds) of the maximum 51,408 pounds held in storage.

The company ensures that tanks and components are regularly maintained by qualified contractors.  The facility
is regularly inspected by both employees, it's insurance carrier, and the state of Oklahoma Department of Agriculture.

This facility would have a maximum of 51,408 pounds of anhydrous ammonia onsite at its peak sales periods.
Administrative operating procedures limit the storage tank to 85% of its capacity.

The worst-case scenario is structural damage to the bulk storage tank containing, at peak operating periods, up 
to 51,408 pounds of NH3.  Failure would result in a near-full release of ammonia within 10 minutes in a rural
environment.  The toxic endpoint has been calculated to 4.0 miles from the tank at which point it would be 
dispersed enough to no longer pose a hazard to the public.  Public receptors include residences.  Environmental
receptors include a national grasslands area open during seasonal hunting periods.  There are no other commercial
or environmental receptors within the distance to endpoint.

The more probable alternative accidental release would involve a transfer hose failure that could potentially 
release up to 100 pounds of anhydrous ammonia before an emergency shutoff valve could be activated.
The toxic endpoint would be limited to 0.2 miles which would expose less than 5 people and no other 
commercial or public receptors.

This facility has not had a reportable accidental release in the last five years.  Employees are trained in the safe
handling, storage and dispensing of anhydrous ammonia by the State of Oklahoma Department of Agriculture.

Employe

es are not permitted to respond to any accidental release that would require the donning of respirator
(SCBA) and full body protection.  Employees are instructed to notify the Roger Mills Fire Department in the event
of an accidental release and evacuate the area as appropriate.

The stores prevention program includes:

*  Only trained and authorized employees permitted to dispense anhydrous ammonia
